en.title: Update on "Hope For Children" Philippines.
en.content:
UPDATE REPORT ON MARY ROSE ( & FAMILY ) FROM PHILIPPINES COUNTRY LICENSEE,
JEREMY LOOI & PRESIDENTIAL DIRECTOR PASTOR ARTHUR MEDINA. 
 
FE's values of Compassion and Social Entrepreneurship is now being lived by FE Leaders in countries like Philippines with the hope that this culture will build up its momentum so that more and more less fortunate of society will be empowered.
Mary Rose is one of the millions of faceless and helpless victims of poverty mentality in the Philippines until FusionExcel came along and helped her whole family get out of the ever stinking and smoking dump site in Payatas, where they lived (pictures above) into a new entrepreneurial environment as seen in the pictures below.
FE's Social Entrepreneurship redefines what a house is for Mary Rose's family. This new house is a fully paid 2 years lease worth P150,000 (roughly US$3,200). After 2 years of stay the same amount of money will be refunded or the contract renewed for another 2 years. In the meantime, a better permanent house and lot for the family is being searched by the "Hope For Children" Steering Committee in the Philippines.

Imagine, if in every country where FE leaders are successfully doing our network marketing business, we likewise touch a few helpless lives like these Payatas children, isn't it that our world will become a better place to live.
Jeremy and Pastor Art were encouraged to see that the family is now engaged in micro enterprises such as selling everyday stuff (variety store) and manufacturing of door mats and pot holders out of recycled garment cut outs. The FE team's visit at their household had been mutually touching as we prayed for God's grace to abound to Mary Rose's family.

'For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat; I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink; I was a stranger and you took me in; I was naked and you clothed me; I was sick and you looked after me; I was in prison and you came to visit me.'
